If you can just surrender your life to Jesus and be forgiven, I'm not sure what prevents that criminal from thinking they can live a criminal lifestyle until they no longer can, and then surrendering their life to Jesus to feel better about themselves.  Also, as far as criminality goes, everything I've read points towards atheists being underrepresented in American jails.  Now, this data should be taken with a grain of salt, because some statistics lump atheists in with Scientologists and other non-mainstream religions, but nothing I've seen seems to suggest that atheists are any more prone to committing crime than a Christian, and there's a crap ton of Christians who believe in Jesus doing lots of crime out there.  In fact, America, which is full of religious Christian people, represents about 4.4% of the world's population, but are responsible for incarcerating 22% of the world's prisoners.  If I were a Christian, I'd be backing slowly away from any arguments that assert Christianity as a catalyst for reducing crime.
